title: [Large-scale] AI-Based Social Learning Regulation Strategy for Scientific Collaboration

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific concepts and experience using online collaboration tools
context.additional_context: A hybrid learning environment combining smartphone-based collaboration and offline discussion sessions, with groups conducting self/peer assessments using AI tools.

learning_goals: Learners can perform SSRL (Scripted Shared-Regulatory Learning) behaviors at a frequency of over 80% in CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) environments using AI-enhanced group awareness tools
Learners can improve the quality of peer feedback by two or more levels on a three-tier rubric using adaptive prompts
Learners demonstrate collaborative design competencies in blended environments through project deliverables and achieve average ratings of 3.5/5 or higher

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
